title.value: Sharing eCC Data from Pathology Labs to EHR

description.value:
The College of American Pathology (CAP) created electronic Cancer Checklist (eCC) Protocols (https://documents.cap.org/protocols/Cancer-Protocols-2020_10Word-and-PDF.zip) for pathologist to use in a laboratory information system (LIS) to capture elements for collecting and reporting cancer patient data. The CAP eCC protocols support improving information exchange between the pathologist and clinician and the pathologist and cancer registries. The electronic protocols are codified using a proprietary code system called cKeys, which is used by the cancer registries. However, this code system is not standard among electronic health record (EHR) systems.
Discrete data elements are captured in electronic format in most LISs, however, EHRs receive data from a pathology lab in an unstructured format. The unstructured format limits the ability to make meaningful decisions on the data and to report data to the jurisdiction-based central cancer registries. There is a need to create an electronic data exchange standard for pathologists to share cancer data with clinicians in hospital system.
This project will use FHIR to support electronic health data exchange of cancer pathology information between a hospital or facility-based laboratory information system (LIS) and hospital or facility-based electronic health record (EHR) system. The goal is to create a data exchange standard and develop a FHIR implementation guide (IG) for sending pathology data captured by pathologists using the College of American Pathology (CAP) electronic Cancer Checklist (eCC) Protocols into an EHR in a discrete, coded format. Creating a standard should lead to more accurate and complete reporting of information from EHRs to jurisdiction-based central cancer registries.
The scope of the first version of this IG will focus on the data elements in the eCC Protocols required for reporting the 6 most common types of cancers: breast, lung, colon and rectum, skin, prostate, and central nervous system. This IG will use the FHIR Document paradigm to exchange information modeled as profiled resources.
For EHR that do not support Bundle endpoints, EHRs should use US Core DocumentReference and base64 encode the content of the document in DocumentReference.content.attachment.data
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ mCode profiles that satisfy eCC reporting requiremetns and can/should be used include: Cancer Patient

Breast Invasive Resection (CAP Version 4.4.0.0) Composition profile comprised of elements required for central registry reporting
Resection Procedure which produced the specimen being examined.
Histologic Type in the Breast

name.value: Breast Resection Histologic Grade (Overall) by Nottingham Observation

description.value: The Nottingham combined histologic grade evaluates the amount of tubule formation, the extent of nuclear pleomorphism, and the mitotic count (or mitotic rate).
This is the breast tissue specimen that is being pathologically tested. Collection.bodySite contains the tumor site, otherwise referred to as the body location from where this specimen was obtained.

display.value: Breast Resection Regional Lymph Node Involvement

name.value: Breast Resection Regional Lymph Node Involvement

description.value: Information regarding Regional Lymph node examination
The presurgical or neoadjuvant treatment and its observed effect/outcome. Treatment effect in breast is found in Procedure.outcome

display.value: Breast Treatment Effect in Lymph Node Procedure

name.value: Breast Treatment Effect in Lymph Node Procedure

description.value: Treatment Effect in the Lymph Nodes (required if nodes are submitted and it is known that the patient had presurgical therapy). Treatment Effect is found in Procedure.outcome
Lymphovascular Invasion in the Breast
Estrogen Receptor in Breast (ER) Summary Status. Performed on Previous biopsy?
Progesterone Receptor (PgR) in the breast
HER2 Observations by both IHC and in situ hybridization methods

Examination of Resection Specimens From Patients With Primary Non-Small Cell Carcinoma, Small Cell Carcinoma, or Carcinoid Tumor of the Lung (CAP Version 4.1.0.1) Composition profile comprised of elements required for central registry reporting

This extension specifies the allowable concepts for Histologic Type on the Lung Resection eCC protocol. It is intended to extend mCode's Primary Cancer Condition and is built upon mCode's Histology-Morphology-Behavior extension.

display.value: Lung Resection Regional Lymph Node Involvement Observation

name.value: Lung Resection Regional Lymph Node Involvement Observation

description.value: Whether or not regional lymph nodes were assessed and if so, what type of metastasis was observed?
Observed pre-surgical treatment in the Lung, and its observed effect/outcome (i.e. relative to the residual viable tumor)
Whether or not Lymphovascular Invasion was observed, and if so, was it Lymphatic, Arterial, and/or Venous?
Examination of Excision Specimens From Patients With Melanoma of the Skin (CAP Version 4.2.0.0)

display.value: Melanoma Regional Lymph Node Involvement Observation

name.value: Melanoma Regional Lymph Node Involvement Observation

description.value: Whether the specimen was obtained by open craniotimy or stereotactic biopsy
Central Nervous System Specimen Examination (CAP Version 4.0.0.0) Composition profile comprised of elements required for central registry reporting

name.value: Treatment Effect in the Central Nervous System

description.value: Knowledge of preoperative treatment, including radiation therapy, chemotherapy, corticosteroid therapy, embolization, and other therapy, is helpful for specimen interpretation.
Biomarker studies performed on central nervous system tissue
Protocol for the Examination of Radical Prostatectomy Specimens From Patients With Carcinoma of the Prostate Gland (CAP Version 4.1.0.1) for reportable data to central cancer registries

display.value: Prostate Regional Lymph Node Involvement Observation

name.value: Prostate Regional Lymph Node Involvement Observation

description.value: Colon and Rectum Primary Carcinoma Resection (CAP Version 4.1.0.0) Composition profile comprised of elements required for central registry reporting

display.value: Colon Rectum Resection Regional Lymph Node Involvement Observation

name.value: Colon Rectum Resection Regional Lymph Node Involvement Observation

description.value: Whether or not Regional Lymph Nodes were examined if present in the specimen.
Mismatch Repair Testing: Microsatellite instability and Immunohistochemistry
Observaitons related to Lymphovascular and Perineural Invasions.
Whther pre-surgical Treatment Effect of Colon/Rectum is observed or not, and if observed, the score of the response to the treatment).

Which procedure was performed to produce the specimen in question. Includes specimens designated total, partial, or segmental resection (Colectomy) as well as Rectal Resections, including low anterior resection or abdominoperineal resections.

display.value: Protocol for the Examination of Resection Specimens From Patients With Invasive Carcinoma of the Breast

name.value: Protocol for the Examination of Resection Specimens From Patients With Invasive Carcinoma of the Breast

description.value: this extension specifies the allowable terminology for the Colon/Rectum Resection eCC protocol.

This extension specifies the allowable concepts for Histologic Type on the Melanoma Excision eCC protocol. It is build upon mCode's 'Histology-Morphology-Behavior' extension and is inteded to extend Primary Cancer Condition
This extensions specifies the allwoable concepts on the Prostate eCC form. It is built upon mCode's 'Histology-Morphology-BEhavior' extension and specifically extends Primary Cancer Condition.
Observation specifying the allowable Primary Tumor (pT) AJCC concepts as equivilent Snomed CT terms.
Observation specifying the allowable Regional Lymph Nodes (pN) AJCC concepts as equivilent Snomed CT terms.
Observation specifying the allowable Distant Metastases (pM) AJCC concepts as equivilent Snomed CT terms.
This profile groups all Regional Lymph Node Involvement information

This grouping profile specifies common structure and terminology related to Lymphovascular Invasion across the following eCC protocols: Breast Resection, Lung Resection, Colon/Rectum Resection, Melanoma Excision, and examination of Prostate and Brain specimens.
Specify free text (string) or CodeableConcepts for involved Regional Lymph Node Sites and Laterality
Extension for the free-text exntry describing examined nodal station(s) in a pathologic specimen
All allowable Histologic Type Snomed Concepts
All allowable Primary Tumor (pT) Snomed concepts
All allowable Regional Lymph Nodes (pN) Snomed concepts
All allowable Distant Metastases (pM) Snomed concepts
Laterality concepts 'left' and 'right'. 'Not Specified' should use standard FHIR concept 'UNK'
Grouping Valueset comprised of 'left' and 'right' and adding 'midline' for Melanoma eCC; 'Not Specified' should use standard FHIR concept 'UNK'
